solution.name: Dropbox
solution.description: This connector will automatically upload assets from your Dropbox folders to Bynder DAM.

items.title: Recursive Folder Builder 1 - Dropbox Public Url

items.content:
This connector will upload assets stored in your Dropbox account to Bynder DAM. 
 Subfolders and assets within the folder you select will be added to Bynder DAM. The connector will check for new assets or folders every two hours, and synchronize any newly added items. In a later page, you can designate values for metaproperties on upload.
Add your Bynder credentials below. Click on 'Add a new account', enter the domain of your portal (https://...) and log in with your username and password.
Add your login credentials for Dropbox in the entry field below. This will require a username and password for your Dropbox account.

Add the folder to sync with Bynder DAM below. From your Dropbox account, navigate to the folder for synchronization. Copy the URL from the browser, and paste it in the field below. It should be a format like https://www.dropbox.com/home/[Encoded_Folder_Name]. The connector will check this folder and all subfolders within it for assets.

If you wish to include sub-folders of the folder indicated above, click the checkbox below. Be aware that large folder structures will slow the total time to synchronize assets from Box. If your folder structure is very large, consider creating multiple Box connections for specific sub-folders within the main folder.

In the table below, enter values to write on all assets migrated from Dropbox. Choose the Bynder metaproperty on the left, and type the desired value on the right hand side. These values will be written to all assets. Assets will also be tagged with 'Dropbox', the file ID, and a description with a link to the folder it was sent from.

The required data for this connector has been entered. Click on the "Finish" button below to initiate the connection. Synchronization of assets from Dropbox will begin immediately. The configuration will be saved and you can modify it by returning to the configuration under "Active Integrations".
If you are not ready to initiate the connection, you can close this window and return at a later time. All the configuration options you've selected will be saved.
